Package me.alien.networking.client

Class Client

java.lang.Object
me.alien.networking.client.Client
public abstract class Client extends Object
Client is the main client class for the networking and will connect to a Server

  • Field Details

    • VERSION

      public final int VERSION
      The version of networking communication used for handshake.
      If you have your own version or other things needed to be completed use connected() and Server.newClient(me.alien.networking.server.Client) to confirm other versions before completion the handshake
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client(String ip, int port) throws IOException
      Base constructor of the Client class.
      When this is called it will connect to the Server through the ip and port.
      Parameters:
      ip - IP to the Server
      port - Port to the Server
      Throws:
      IOException - If the Socket failed to be created or unable to create a PrintStream or BufferedReader

    • Client

      public Client(String ip) throws IOException
      Base constructor of the Client class.
      When this is called it will connect to the Server through the ip and default port.
      this will call Client(String ip, int port) with the default port 6550
      Parameters:
      ip - IP to the Server
      Throws:
      IOException - If the Socket failed to be created or unable to create a PrintStream or BufferedReader

  • Method Details

    • messageReceive

      public abstract void messageReceive(Serializable message, boolean fatal, boolean exit)
      messageReceive(Serializable, boolean, boolean) gets called when messageReceiveThread receives a new message
      Parameters:
      message - A class that needs to implument Serializable to contain some sort of data. see examples package
      fatal - If this is true then the connection will be closed directly after this method is complete. If its true then the message will be a FatalPackage and it will contain a FatalPackage.reason and FatalPackage.error that will describe the issue
      exit - If this is true then the server is requesting this connection to be closed. This is followed by a region but no mather what the socket will be closed, reconnection can be done.

    • connected

      public abstract void connected()
      connected() will be called when it's done with the initial handshake hear its possible to do some second hand handshake to confirm more information

    • send

      public void send(Serializable message) throws IOException
      This will send the message to Server that it's connected too.
      Parameters:
      message - An object that implements the Serializable to be sent
      Throws:
      IOException - If the Socket.getOutputStream()'s OutputStream throws a IOException

    • end

      public void end(String reason) throws IOException
      Sends an exit package to close the connection to the server
      Parameters:
      reason - the reason way the connection was ended.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the Socket.getOutputStream()s OutputStream throws a IOException
